DOC.brief_title: A Comparison Two Triple-Drug Combinations Patients Who Have Never Been Treated With Anti-HIV Drugs

Exclusion Criteria Coexisting Condition : Patients follow symptoms condition exclude : Bilateral peripheral neuropathy . Intractable diarrhea . Proven suspect acute hepatitis within 30 day prior study entry . Concurrent Medication : Excluded : Therapy coexist disease may interfere patient ability participate study . Concurrent Treatment : Excluded : Therapy coexist disease may interfere patient ability participate study . Patients follow prior condition exclude : History acute chronic pancreatitis . Prior Medication : Excluded : Therapy previous disease may interfere patient ability participate study . Excluded within 14 day prior randomization : Greater 4 week nucleoside therapy great 1 week protease inhibitor therapy . Excluded within 3 month start study expect need time enrollment : Agents significant systemic myelosuppressive , neurotoxic , pancreatoxic , hepatotoxic , cytotoxic potential .
